publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5049 Tommy Sheridan: Support Cuban Women Against Blockade—That the Parliament notes with very great concern the economic, financial and commercial blockade on Cuba being intensified by the Bush plan; acknowledges that this continuing blockade has fostered solidarity among Cuban women within the family, the community and the social environment; further notes the international solidarity from friends and women’s organisations in the United States of America and other countries which reject the US administration’s hostility, and recognises the indomitable spirit of the Federation of Cuban Women in dealing with the shortages. Supported by: Campbell Martin*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Chris Ballance*

S2M-5049 Tommy Sheridan: Support Cuban Women Against Blockade—That the Parliament notes with very great concern the economic, financial and commercial blockade on Cuba being intensified by the Bush plan; acknowledges that this continuing blockade has fostered solidarity among Cuban women within the family, the community and the social environment; further notes the international solidarity from friends and women’s organisations in the United States of America and other countries which reject the US administration’s hostility, and recognises the indomitable spirit of the Federation of Cuban Women in dealing with the shortages. Supported by: Campbell Martin, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Chris Ballance, Elaine Smith*
S2M-5049 Support Cuban Women Against Blockade (lodged on 31 October 2006) Ms Sandra White*
